speakers.biography: CEO European Web Video Academy GmbH, Deutscher Webvideopreis, Videocamp, Journalist, Videopunk

sessions.title: YouTube – zwischen Wildwest und Goldgrube.

speakers.name: Amélie Anglade
speakers.biography: Amélie Anglade is a developer at SoundCloud. By day she researches, prototypes and implements search engines, audio recommender systems and other Music Information Retrieval algorithms. By night she volunteers at the OpenTechSchool and the Berlin Geekettes trying to get more women into programming and tech.

sessions.title: Music Recommendation – Future Casting
Music Recommendation – Future Casting

speakers.name: Dieter Zetsche
speakers.position: Vorsitzender des Vorstands der Daimler AG und Leiter Mercedes-Benz Cars
speakers.biography: Dr. Dieter Zetsche ist Vorsitzender des Vorstands der Daimler AG und Leiter Mercedes-Benz Cars. Geboren wurde er am 5. Mai 1953 in Istanbul. Er wuchs in Oberursel bei Frankfurt/Main auf. Nach dem Abitur studierte er Elektrotechnik an der Universität Karlsruhe. Seine Karriere begann er 1976 bei der Daimler-Benz AG im Forschungsbereich. Er arbeitete in zahlreichen Führungspositionen sowohl im Pkw- als auch im Nutzfahrzeugbereich – in Deutschland, Brasilien, Argentinien und den USA.1992 wurde er als Pkw-Entwicklungschef in den Vorstand der Mercedes-Benz AG berufen. 1998 trat er in den Vorstand der DaimlerChrysler AG ein, wo er zunächst für den Vertrieb und dann für die Nutzfahrzeugsparte verantwortlich zeichnete. 2000 wurde er Präsident und Geschäftsführer der DaimlerChrysler Corporation. Seit 2006 ist er Vorstandsvorsitzender der Daimler AG.

sessions.title: Das vernetzte Auto – wie verändert sich unsere Mobilität? Ein Gespräch mit Dieter Zetsche.

speakers.name: Carolin Hinz
speakers.biography:
Ich bin Carolin, 31 Jahre alt, derzeit sesshaft in Bremen. Wenn ich nicht gerade im Tourismusmarketing der Welt erzähle, wie toll Bremen ist, kümmere ich mich um freie Projekte. Ich betreue z.B. den Rotation Curation Account @Iam_Bremen, schreibe ein Reiseblog unter dem schönen Titel www.esel-unterwegs.de und steuere gelegentlich Artikel für www.bremen-fuer-lau.de bei. Ach ja, als freie Kommunikationsberaterin kann man mich auch buchen. Politisch bin ich bei den Pirat*innen aktiv, was tatsächlich viel Zeit von meinen diversen Projekten abzieht.
Ich bin in meinem Leben schon ganz schön rum gekommen, das passt alles gar nicht in 1000 Zeichen. Schaut euch einfach meine Webprofile an oder sprecht mich direkt an. Ich freue mich darauf, euch kennenzulernen ;-)

sessions.title: #RotationCuration - eine Kulturbewegung erobert Twitter weltweit

speakers.name: Elias Barrasch
speakers.position: Co-Founder, Design-based Learning, Teacher, Design Thinking, Future of Work & Education,
speakers.biography: Elias Barrasch ist Kommunikations- und Interaktionsdesigner. Er entwickelt in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Pädagogen auf Grundlage von Methoden aus der Innovationsforschung und digitalen Medien neue Lern- und Arbeitsformate wie z.B. "Designbasiertes Lernen". Im von Google initiierten Think Tank "Internet & Gesellschaft Co:llaboratory" koordinierte er die Arbeitsgruppe "Zukunft der Arbeit, Innovation und Entrepreneurship". Zuvor studierte Elias Wirtschaftskommunikation sowie Kommunikationsdesign und aufbauend Design Thinking. Weiterhin hat er seine Erfahrung in international agierenden Agenturen in strategischer Kommunikationsplanung, digitalen Mediengestaltung und Public Relations vertieft. Im Rahmen seiner Learning Journey untersuchte er Organisationen mit einer ausgeprägten Innovationskultur in Europa und den USA. Neben seiner Tätigkeit bei Creative Confidence hat er einen Lehrauftrag an der HPI School of Design Thinking.

sessions.title: Best Practice: Medienkompetenz re:learned

speakers.name: Sebastian Deterding
speakers.organization: Hans Bredow Institute for Media Research
speakers.biography: Aspiring architect in the cathedral of human understanding. Designer and researcher working on games, gameful design, playful design, gamification. Editor, "The Gameful World", to appear with MIT Press.

sessions.title: Code Literacy – Verstehen, was uns online lenkt

speakers.name: Christoph Meinel
speakers.biography:
Christoph Meinel ist Geschäftsführer, wissenschaftlicher Leiter und Direktor des Hasso-Plattner-Instituts für Softwaresystemtechnik (HPI).
Christoph Meinel ist ordentlicher Professor (C4) für Informatik am HPI und an der Universität Potsdam und hat den Lehrstuhl für Internet-Technologien und -Systeme inne.
Seine besonderen Forschungsinteressen liegen im Bereich Internet-Technologien und Informationssicherheit, Web 3.0, Semantic-, Social-, Service-Web, sowie auf dem Gebiet des Designs innovativer Internetanwendungen, vor allem in den Bereichen e-Learning und Telemedizin. Daneben ist er wissenschaftlich aktiv auf dem Gebiet der Innovationsforschung rund um die Innovationsmethode des Design Thinking.
Christoph Meinel lehrt in den Bachelor- und Masterstudiengängen IT-Systems Engineering, betreut zahlreiche Doktoranden und ist Teacher an der HPI School of Design Thinking. Zudem ist er Gastprofessor an den Fakultä-ten für Informatik der Technischen Universität Peking und der Shanghai Universität und Research Fellow am interdisziplinären Zentrum (SnT) der Universität Luxemburg.

sessions.title: brand eins

speakers.name: Diedrich Diederichsen
speakers.biography: Geb. 1957 in Hamburg. In den 80er Jahren Redakteur und Herausgeber von Musikzeitschriften, in den 90er Hochschullehrer als Gastprofessor oder Lehrbeauftragter u.a. in Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Pasadena, Offenbach, Gießen, Weimar, Bremen, Wien, St. Louis, Köln, Los Angeles und Gainesville. 1998 - 2006 Professor für Ästhetische Theorie/Kulturwissenschaften an der Merz-Akademie, Stuttgart, seit 2006 Professor für Theorie, Praxis und Vermittlung von Gegenwartskunst am Institut für Kunst- und Kulturwissenschaften der Akademie der bildenden Künste Wien

speakers.biography: Lebt und arbeitet in Frankfurt am Main. Zweiteres an der FH mit der Mission Social- und E-Learning. Eine aus 3 Veranstaltern des legendären #mmc13.

sessions.title: Gute MOOCs - böse MOOCs? Openness als Killerkriterium!

speakers.name: Dino Trescher
speakers.biography: Dino Trescher is a science journalist and founder of the Constart Correspondent Network, an alliance of 29 international journalists, reporting about topics at the interface of science, technology and society. Since 1997 his work is published in renowned media outlet in German and English language. Based in Berlin he shares his expertise in cross boarders teams and reports on knowledge intensive and societal relevant topics. Teaming up with correspondents he won scholarships from the Journalismfund and the Robert Bosch Foundation to investigate themes in-depth with a data driven approach, e.g. EU research funding, risk research and nanotechnology. In addition, he teaches scientific writing at Alice Salomon University and moderates techno-scientific debates.

sessions.title: Goldene Zeiten für Entrepreneurial Science Journalism?

speakers.name: Peter Troxler
speakers.biography:
I am a researcher at the intersection of business administration, society and technology.
Currently, my main focus is investigating and developing the Third Industrial Revolution. This is part of my employment as a Research Professor at the Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences.
I'm also interested in business models of open source anything – design, hardware, inventions – and the corresponding formats and ecologies of innovation and co-creation.

sessions.title: 3D Printing: (How) can we make it a third industrial revolution?

speakers.name: Daniel Knapp
speakers.biography: Daniel Knapp ist Ingenieur für Informatik und Digitale Medien. Er konzeptioniert und realisiert seit 15 Jahren Anwendungen für das Internet und legt seinen Schwerpunkt auf die Gründungs- und Wachstumphase von Unternehmen. Seit 2012 arbeitet er als Mitgründer und CEO von ExpertSight an Software zur Vorausschau und forscht zu Fragestellungen der Gesundheitsbranche. Davor hat er an individualisierten Online-Verhaltensschulungen für chronisch kranke Patienten gearbeitet. Er freut sich auf die zukünftigen Einsatzmöglichkeiten von IT zur Verbesserung der Gesundheitsversorgung.

sessions.title: Ein Blick in die Zukunft der Personalisierten Medizin

speakers.name: Nicole Ambacher
speakers.biography: Nicole Ambacher ist Zukunftsforscherin und hat eine Leidenschaft für die Gestaltung von Konzepten der Gesundheitsversorgung, die auch Morgen und Übermorgen noch tragfähig sind. Sie hat Zukunftsforschung im Masterprogramm der Freien Universität studiert und arbeitet seither freiberuflich in Forschung und Wirtschaft. Ihr Fokus liegt auf der Vorausschau im Gesundheitswesen und der Weiterentwicklung von Methoden der Zukunftsforschung für den Einsatz in Unternehmen. Sie hat zuvor Pflegepädagogik studiert und in der Patientenversorgung und Ausbildung von Pflegepersonal in Deutschland, Wales und Gambia in West Afrika gearbeitet. Für ein Start-Up in Berlin hat sie E-Health-Angebote für chronisch kranke Patienten konzeptioniert.

sessions.title: Ein Blick in die Zukunft der Personalisierten Medizin

speakers.name: Friedrich von Borries
speakers.position: Professor für Designtheorie an der HFBK Hamburg, Kurator, Autor
speakers.biography:
Friedrich von Borries, * 1974, ist seit 2009 Professor für Designtheorie und kuratorische Praxis an der HFBK Hamburg. Dort leitet er das DFG geförderte Forschungsprojekt „Urbane Interventionen“.
2008 war von Borries Generalkommissar und Kurator für den Deutschen Beitrag auf der XI. Architekturbiennale
(2008) in Venedig, 2010 kuratierte er die Ausstellung “Klimakapseln” im Museum für Kunst und Gewerbe Hamburg.
Friedrich von Borries publiziert über Fragen von Kunst, Architektur und Design in Monopol und schreibt für Die Zeit, FAZ und Die Welt. Zuletzt erschien von ihm im Merve Verlag der “Glossar der Interventionen”und bei Suhrkamp der Roman 1WTC.

speakers.name: Rachel Gichinga
speakers.biography: Rachel is passionate about the intersection of tech, development, advocacy and creativity. Projects that she’s worked on mostly include using the internet and artistic expression to get young Kenyans actively and consciously engaged in political development. At some point in her life she co-founded an online advocacy startup, Kuweni Serious, and she is an alumna of the Acumen Fund East Africa Fellows Program. She is also solely responsible for any and all Beyonce tracks that play at the iHub.

speakers.biography:
Kommunikationsberater bei SCRIPT Communications in Frankfurt, 12 Jahre Offizier der Bundeswehr (Fallschirmjäger, Operative Information), Studium der Geschichts- und Sozialwissenschaften, mehrere Einsätze im ehemaligen Jugoslawien, Aufbau des ersten Einsatzkameratrupps der Bundeswehr.
Seit 2007 veröffentlicht er unter bendler-blog.de seine Anmerkungen zur sicherheitspolitischen Kommunikation.

speakers.name: Katarzyna  Szymielewicz
speakers.biography:
Human rights lawyer and activist. Co-founder and president of Panoptykon Foundation – a Polish NGO defending human rights in the context of surveillance society and a member of European Digital Rights.       
Advisor to the Minister for Administration and Digitalisation in Poland. Since 2012 vice-president of European Digital Rights. Graduate of the University of Warsaw (Law) and the School of Oriental and African Studies (Development Studies).     
Active in many recent European debates and campaigns regarding digital rights: fights against blanket data retention, Internet blocking and ACTA and the fight for better data protection standards in online environment.

sessions.title: Personal Data: Nothing to hide?

speakers.biography: War Lokalreporter, Politikschreiber, Textchef und zweimal Chef vom Dienst, bei immer wieder wunderbaren Medien: SZ, AZ, FTD (†) und Spiegel Online.

speakers.biography:
Comedy writer/director of Father Ted &  Big Train (with Arthur Mathews), Black Books (with Dylan Moran), The IT Crowd (with himself). Adapted The Ladykillers for the stage.
Currently working on The Count Arthur Strong Show and a final IT Crowd special. Developing projects at Delightful Industries with Richard Boden.

speakers.name: Claudio Guarnieri
speakers.biography:
Claudio is a security researcher at Rapid7, specialized in tracking, dissecting and understanding malware and botnets.
He dedicates his free time to the no-profit organizations The Honeynet Project and The Shadowserver Foundation and developing open source projects.
He participated and co-authored several researches in the last year concerning commercial surveillance technologies, such as FinFisher, and their use in countries with critical human rights records.
He's a strong advocate for free software and loves when technology successfully serves freedom of speech and of sharing. He secretly nurtures a fascination for political, social and economical implications of technology and the Internet, which he's dedicated at making better.

speakers.biography: Sandra Schüssel ist verantwortlich für Produktentwicklung und -management bei der MVB, der Wirtschaftstochter des Börsenvereins des Deutschen Buchhandels. Zum Portfolio der MVB gehört das Verzeichnis lieferbarer Bücher, mit mehr als 1,5 Millionen aktiven Titeln und 1,9 archivierten Titeln das zentrale Marketing- und Rechercheinstrument der Buchbranche.

speakers.name: Carles Ferreiro
speakers.biography:
Carles Ferreiro is co-founder of dotopen, an open innovation consulting firm advising start-ups and established companies with their strategic positioning, defining business models, creating alliances, and identifying market and funding opportunities. He is also co-founder of MobileMonday Barcelona, and MobileMonday Madrid.
At dotopen he has consulted companies large and small in how to best navigate and utilize the opportunities of an open innovation environment and has fostered ecosystem development through events like Mobile Peer Awards and Mobile 2.0 Europe. Previously, he was Director Art Center College of Design where he directed the development of innovation programs with ESADE, SEAT and BCD. Before still, Carles has been Director of Strategic Developement at Barcelona Media and Director of the Mobile Communications practice at Frost & Sullivan, first from Silicon Valley and later from London, leading projects with the most important industry players worldwide.

sessions.title: New Open Cities Challenge: Managing large tourism flows

speakers.name: Deanna Zandt
speakers.biography: Deanna Zandt is a media technologist, the co-founder of and partner at Lux Digital, and the author of Share This! How You Will Change the World with Social Networking (Berrett-Koehler, June 2010). She is a consultant to key media and advocacy organizations, and her clients have included The Ford Foundation, The Daily Beast/Newsweek, and Jim Hightower’s Hightower Lowdown. Zandt is contributor to Forbes.com via her ForbesWoman “Prospect: Tech” blog, and a social media advice contributor NPR’s flagship news program, “All Things Considered.” She has advised the White House on digital strategy and public engagement. Zandt specializes in social media, is a leading expert in women and technology, and is a frequent guest on CNN International, BBC Radio, Fox News and more.

sessions.title: Ecstasy and Despair: How Powerful Emotions Trigger Digital Activism

speakers.name: Oliver Petzoldt
speakers.biography: Educational technology Expert. Since January 2009 working for GIZ in Ethiopia. Co-founder of iceaddis, an innovation hub, incubator and co-working space in Addis Ababa. Passionate about open innovation, social entrepreneurship & beta-culture.

sessions.title: Why innovation, collaboration and entrepreneurship matters? Experiences in Green Technology Innovation from Ethiopia
New Approaches to Usability Engineering for Mobiles through Tech-hubs?

speakers.name: Juergen  Erbeldinger
speakers.biography:
Dr. Juergen Erbeldinger beschäftigt sich seit zehn Jahren mit Innovations-Management.  Er ist Gründer und CEO der partake AG mit 60 Mitarbeitern und Sitz in Berlin. Zu seinen Kunden zählen u.a.: Allianz SE, Commerzbank AG, Deutsche Bank, EADS, E.ON AG, LBBW, Siemens, Swisscom.
Erbeldinger entwickelt zentrale Ideen des Design Thinking weiter und prägt einen ganz neuen Management Ansatz: den Kern bilden einfache Prinzipien, die sich schnell und unmittelbar anwenden und implementieren lassen. In ihrer Wirkung zielen diesen Prinzipien auf die Unternehmenskultur und die Innovation des Managements selbst.
Erbeldinger studierte Volkswirtschaftslehre und Mathematik an der Freien Universität Berlin. Zusammen mit dem Wirtschaftstheoretiker Professor Ulrich Baßeler beschäftigte er sich mit der Simulation von ökonomischen Prozessen und promovierte über die Zusammenhänge zwischen Geldpolitik und Ökonomie.

sessions.title: brand eins

speakers.name: Guido Bülow
speakers.biography: Guido Bülow ist seit dem 1. April 2010 Distributionsmanager beim SWR, wo er das Social Media Team in der HA SWR.Online leitet und die Social Media Aktivitäten verantwortet. Nach dem Studium der Allgemeinen Sprachwissenschaft, Wirtschaftsgeschichte und Informationswissenschaft an der Heinrich-Heine Universität Düsseldorf volontierte er von 2006 bis 2007 beim Radiosender bigFM in der Musikredaktion und arbeitete dort anschließend als Online Music Manager und als Marketing Manager. Neben dem Beruf absolviert er noch ein Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften an der FernUni Hagen und schreibt für sein eigenes Blog.

sessions.title: Wie Fernsehen und Online zusammenwachsen: die SWR-Projekte “Zeit der Helden” und “Tatort+ 2013”

speakers.biography: Political scientist and journalist, editor for www.netz-gegen-nazis.de and project coordinator for no-nazi.net, focusing on Neonazi activities online and hate speech on the internet

speakers.name: Sergi Martinez
speakers.biography:
Android Team Lead at Tempos 21 and co-founder of Catdroid (Catalonian Android Community). More than 15 years working on several fields of computer technologies, specialized in software localization and mobile development.
Highly interested on  fields like Internet Of Things and Open Data and their application on the mobile applications.

sessions.title: Fueling your app with dynamic Open Data

speakers.name: Katalin Gallyas
speakers.biography: Policy Advisor Open Innovation- City of Amsterdam. Managing 3 EU Open Innovation projects in Amsterdam to show the added value for Open Data, Open Source App Development and working with commons and smart toolkits in cities. Responsible for EU and local policy lobby. Engaged with setting up Civic Innovators' network and an  innovation hub between cities, innovation labs, hackers and start ups.

sessions.title: How Cities can foster innovation with apps and Open Data

speakers.name: Ele Jansen
speakers.organization: Reboot Stories, University of New South Wales, Sydney
speakers.biography: As a media anthropologist Ele explores life for the new generation of creative entrepreneurs at the cross-section of collaboration, storytelling and design. Fusing her PhD with R&D at Reboot Stories resulted in www.learndoshare.net, which harnesses pitfalls and successes of open design. Playing with chaordic methodologies she likes to integrate what seems mutually exclusive: creativity and structure, reasoning and intuition, play and work, fast and slow, corporate and indie. Having a soft spot for digital avant-gardes, the native German collaborates with u.lab, xm:lab and publishes for Germany’s most renowned interactive media department at Filmakademie Baden-Wurttemberg. Ele designed processes for innovation incubators, creative industries and big brands since 2001.

sessions.title: Boosting Creative Entrepreneurship in NYC, Berlin and Amsterdam
[ws]labs ‘creative entrepreneurship’

speakers.name: Andriankoto Harinjaka Ratozamanana
speakers.biography:
Harinjaka Andriankoto RATOZAMANANA is a New Media Strategist, Social Entrepreneur and Pioneer in New Media in Madagascar. He is co-founder and CEO of Habaka -Madagascar Innovation Hub, a nonprofit organisation which lead Madagascar’s youth in Web and Mobile Technology. Habaka's vision emphasizes new media tools and their use in solving issues of concern to all in Madagascar and its continent, including the most marginalized and impoverished.
Ratozamanana is an international consultant who understands how the web can be applied to the purposes of the development of his contient.  For example, he was member of ATPS (African Technology Policy Network) a multi-disciplinary network of researchers, practitioners and policy makers that promotes science, technology and innovation (STI) for African Development.
Ratozamanana came into international fame after being selected by TED (www.ted.com), which stands for Technology Entertainment and Design as inaugural fellow.  TED is often referred to as “the Davos of ideas and communication.”   As a TED Fellow in Arusha, Tanzania in 2007, and also TED Fellow in Long Beach California in 2009, Andriankoto Harinjaka Ratozamanana was recognized as an outstanding young world leader who demonstrated achievement and potential, especially in improving the lives of young people in his local communities.

sessions.title: Introducing: Habaka Madagascar Innovation Hub

speakers.name: Jörgen van der Sloot
speakers.biography: Jörgen van der Sloot develops creative thinking strategies. He is a Fellow of FreedomLab Future Studies and lead developer of its ThinkLab methodology. In a ThinkLab a team is challenged to deal with a wicked problem from a future perspective in order to construct a shared worldview, vision and strategy. As a host and enabler of such strategic and creative conversations Jörgen helps a group of people to take an outside-in perspective. He designs a collaborative space and a collective mindset that generates new thinking and creates solutions for the future. Jörgen has collaborated with many internationally operating organizations in the fields of media and consumer brands, finance and investment, insurance and pensions, education and charity. He has hosted sessions for groups ranging in size from 3 people to 400 people and from boardroom to classroom. He lectures at various business schools in the Netherlands on media innovation, design, entrepreneurship and technology.

sessions.title: Boosting Creative Entrepreneurship in NYC, Berlin and Amsterdam
Debunking conspiracy theories
Opening Global Innovation Lounge

speakers.name: Hubert Wandjo
speakers.biography:
Nach seinem Studium der Betriebswirtschaft an der Universität Mannheim begann Hubert Wandjo seine Laufbahn in der Musikbranche im Marketing bei CBS Schallplatten. Dort durchlief er sämtliche Marketing Stationen und avancierte zum Musikchef des Unternehmens. 1989 erhielt er zusätzlich die Verantwortung für den gesamten A&R-Bereich des Unternehmens, das zu diesem Zeitpunkt bereits unter dem Namen Sony Music firmierte. 
Fünf Jahre später wechselte er als stellvertretender Geschäftsführer in die Chefetage von Sony Music. 1996 kam schließlich die Ernennung zum Managing Director von Columbia; diese Position bekleidete er bis zum Sommer 1997. Im August 1997 wechselte er zu Warner Music nach Hamburg, wo er bis September 2001 als Geschäftsführer von eastwest records tätig war. Im Jahre 2002 gründete Hubert Wandjo zusammen mit Michael Herberger und Xavier Naidoo das Musiklabel Beats Around the Busch. 
Ab Juni 2003 wurde Hubert Wandjo zusammen mit Udo Dahmen und Dirk Metzger Geschäftsführer der Popakademie Baden-Württemberg. Nach dem Ausscheiden von Dirk Metzger übernahm er im Juni 2007 dessen Aufgaben als Business Direktor und Studiengangsleiter im Bereich Musikbusiness. Im April 2008 wurde Hubert Wandjo der Professorentitel verliehen.

sessions.title: ... and the rest will follow! (Digitale) Musikwirtschaft und Regionalentwicklung. Ein Zusammenhang in Gegenwart und Zukunft.

speakers.name: Tayo Akinyemi
speakers.biography: Tayo is an entrepreneurship enthusiast who has worked for several young ventures in the US, Africa, and  Latin America.  Tayo also has experience in the development and nonprofit sectors.  She began her career at an NGO dedicated to advancing women in corporate business.  Since then she has focused, with varying degrees of success, on understanding how businesses are built and sustained.  From developing a community-inclusive business strategy for a greenfield sugarcane ethanol venture in Mozambique to executing the US entry strategy for a digital marketing company in Brazil, Tayo has also explored the social impact of commercial business.  To that end, Tayo wrote for NextBillion, a blog dedicated to exploring development and enterprise, for nearly two years and is a contributor to Tekedia, a blog focused on African technology and innovation.  Tayo has an MBA in Sustainable Global Enterprise from Cornell University, and a BA in Sociology from Princeton University.

sessions.title: Opening Global Innovation Lounge

speakers.name: Wolfgang Spreicer
speakers.biography: Forschungsassistent am Institut f. Gestaltungs- und Wirkungsforschung der TU Wien. Diplomarbeit zum Thema objektbasierte Interfaces. 2009 Sieger des “Interactive TV Award” der Deutschen Telekom.  Schreibt derzeit an seiner Dissertation zum Thema objektbasierte Kommunikation für ältere Menschen auf Basis von Internet of Things Technologien. Zahlreiche wissenschaftliche Veröffentlichung zu diesem Thema.

sessions.title: Best Practice-Projekte: Digitale Inklusion

speakers.name: Anders Levermann
speakers.organization: Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research, Germany
speakers.biography: Trained as a theoretical physicist in Germany and Israel, Dr Levermann was appointed Professor of the Dynamics of the Climate System in 2007. His research at the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research has focused on the tipping elements of the climate system, large-scale abrupt changes with potentially strong impacts on human society. Since 2012 he leads research on global adaptation strategies at the Potsdam Institute, developing a dynamic damage model for the global production and supply network. Prof Levermann has published about 60 scientific articles with more than a thousand citations. He has induced discussions on the limit of adaptation to climate change in a number of articles in Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung and Nature magazine. He is a lead author of the sea-level-change chapter of the upcoming report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). Prof. Levermann advises government representatives, members of parliament, political parties as well as economic stakeholders and journalists with respect to climate change issues. He is active on Facebook and Twitter and co-author of the blog KlimaLounge.

sessions.title: IN, SIDE, OUT of SCIENCE

speakers.name: Moon Ribas
speakers.biography:
Moon Ribas is a Catalan contemporary choreographer and the co-founder of the Cyborg Foundation, an international organisation that aims to help people become cyborgs, defend cyborg rights and promote cyborgism as an artistic and social movement.
Since 2007 Moon has been experimenting with different cybernetics devices that allow her to perceive movement with another way of perception.
Her new research consists in perceiving the movement of real-time earthquakes all around the world, and then translate this new sense on the stage.

sessions.title: Life with extra Senses - How to become a Cyborg.

speakers.name: Neil Harbisson
speakers.biography:
Neil Harbisson is a Catalan contemporary artist, composer and cyborg activist best known for his ability to hear colours and to perceive colours outside the ability of human vision.
Neil was born with achromatopsia, a condition that only allowed him to see in greyscale. In 2003, he took part in the development of the eyeborg, a cybernetic eye permanently attached to his head that allows him to hear the frequencies of colours through bone conduction (including infrareds and ultraviolets). 
Harbisson started to feel like a cyborg, a union between his organism and cybernetics, when he started to hear colours in his dreams. Since then, he creates sonochromatic art works and performances that explore the relationship between colour and sound, and the relationship between bodies and cybernetics.
In 2010 he co-founded the Cyborg Foundation with Moon Ribas, an international organization that aims to help people become cyborgs, defend cyborg rights and promote cyborgism as an artistic and social movement.

speakers.name: Catherine Barba
speakers.biography:
Catherine Barba, pioneer of the digital revolution in France, is an expert of digital retail and omnichannel commerce. She has received numerous distinctions including that of “Femme en Or” 2011 and Alumni of the Year ESCP Europe 2012.
Her company Catherine Barba Group works for retailers and global brands in their quest for omnichannel: What is a good connected retail experience? How to use digital tools to offer a fully integrated experience that engages the customer in both the virtual and the physical worlds?
Prior to that, Catherine managed OMD Interactive (Omnicom group), then became from 1999 to 2003 Managing Director of iFrance, a company launched by the French renowned entrepreneur Marc Simoncini. She started several businesses in the digital industry such as Malinea, a consulting firm for digital business, mobile and e-commerce (acquired by vente-privee.com in 2011), and Cashstore, a cashback website partnering with 1,200 e-commerce merchants, acquired by Plebicom Group in 2010.
She imported in France the CyberMonday, is the author of books about e-commerce, including  « 2020, the end of e-commerce?», «The brave and fearless e-shopper » and the blog malineaconseil.com, which won the French e-commerce blog award  in 2010.
She is also administrator of several tech start-ups, including Leetchi.com, Sojeans.com, Frenchweb.fr, MeilleurMobile.com, and columnist on French Business radio BFM. Catherine is very much involved in women, youth and employment, and sponsors associations such as 100 000 Entrepreneurs or Josephine, that aims at restoring women’s dignity and faith in the future.

speakers.name: Keren Elazari
speakers.biography: ﻿Born and Raised in Tel Aviv, Israel, Keren Elazari is a security expert, a public speaker and a key member of the Israeli Cyber Security & Hacking scene for more than 12 years.  Since 2000, Keren has been employed with leading Israeli security firms, government organizations, Big 4 and Fortune 500 companies. Keren has organized, hosted and participated at international security events such as Y2Hack04 & ILHack09 in Tel Aviv, ITBN 2007 Security Day in Budapest, co-chaired IDC Herzliya Cyber Terrorism Workshop in 2010, the prestigious NATO International conference on Cyber Conflict in 2011 and 2012 and has been an invited speaker at international media events such as DLD, Campus Party and WIRED.  During 2012 Keren held the position of  Teaching Fellow - Security with Singularity University in Mountain View, California.  Keren holds a BA in History & Philosophy of Science and Technologies from Tel Aviv University, and the international accreditation for Information Security professionals, CISSP since 2007.  She is currently a research fellow with Tel Aviv University's Security Studies program, focusing on the effects of hacking and cyber warfare on global politics.  Keren also works as a security industry analyst with GigaOM.com , the leading independent voice on emerging technologies and the disruption of media, covering emerging technologies in mobile device security & cloud security. Keren is fluent in both English & Hebrew, likes to practice Aikido and travel the world.

Er ist einer von über 2000 Wissenschaftlern, die am CMS-Experiment am CERN in Genf an fundamentalen Fragen zu Struktur und Aufbau der Materie forschen. Christophs Arbeitsschwerpunkt ist die weltweit auf etwa 50 Standorte verteilte Computing-Infrastruktur des Experiments.
Im alltäglichen Spagat zwischen Familie und Beruf ist Christoph wenig optimistisch, bei seinen privaten Projekten entscheidend voranzukommen, so dass seine persönliche Bestleistung im Halbmarathon weiter knapp über der Zweistundenmarke bleiben wird. Auch der Plan, den heimischen Toaster mit Linux oder NetBSD auszustatten, wird wohl wieder verschoben werden müssen.

speakers.name: Betsy Hoover
speakers.biography:
Betsy Hoover is a partner with 270 Strategies and leads the firm’s digital strategy practice. She joins the team after serving most recently as Director of Digital Organizing for the 2012 Obama for America campaign, where she was primarily responsible for bridging the gap between online and “off-line” organizing. Betsy was recognized as one of Forbes magazine’s “30 Under 30: Law & Policy” list in 2011 for her work on the president’s re-election campaign and Mother Jones magazine described her as one of “Obama’s digital gurus” with the role “of a community builder, helping channel enthusiasm online into fundraising dollars and volunteer shifts.”
Betsy got her start in the Obama organization as an organizer in South Carolina in 2007. She transitioned to digital organizing in 2010 while working alongside Mitch Stewart, Jeremy Bird, and other members of the 270 Strategies team at Organizing for America, the grassroots organization born out of the 2008 Obama campaign and dedicated to supporting the President’s policy initiatives.
Betsy has long-identified herself as an organizer and knew from the time she was a child that she wanted to change the world. Her experience includes working for Sojourners/Call to Renewal as a Development Associate specializing in online fundraising.
She currently lives in Chicago’s Lakeview neighborhood and enjoys skiing, running, music, and anything in the water.

Andreas Schleicher is Deputy Director for Education and Skills and Special Advisor on Education Policy to OECD’s Secretary-General. He also provides strategic oversight over OECD’s work on the development and utilisation of skills and their social and economic outcomes. This includes the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA), the OECD Survey of Adult Skills (PIAAC), the OECD Teaching and Learning International Survey (TALIS) and the development and analysis of benchmarks on the performance of education systems (INES). Before joining the OECD, he was Director for Analysis at the International Association for Educational Achievement (IEA). 
He studied Physics in Germany and received a degree in Mathematics and Statistics in Australia. He is the recipient of numerous honours and awards, including the “Theodor Heuss” prize, awarded in the name of the first president of the Federal Republic of Germany for “exemplary democratic engagement”. He holds an honorary Professorship at the University of Heidelberg.

speakers.biography: Open systems advocate, technologist, artist and educator Irene Agrivina is a graduate of the Graphic Design faculty at the Indonesia Institute of Art (ISI), Yogyakarta, and holds a Masters of Culture and Religion Degree from Sanata Dharma University in Yogyakarta. She is one of the founding members and current directors of HONF, the Yogyakarta based new media and technology laboratory. Created in 1998 as a place of open expression, art and cultural technologies in the wake of the Indonesian "revolution", HONF aka the 'House of Natural Fiber' was born out of the social and political turmoil against the Suharto regime, its nepotism and governmental corruption. Agrivina runs HONF's 'Education Focus Programme' (EFP) which focuses on the application and practical use in daily life of collaborative, cross-disciplinary and technological actions responding to social, cultural and environmental challenges. In response to the needs of societies in development and transition, HONF and EFP apply open, collaborative and sustainable actions that systematically expand or convert accessible technologies to be used as multifunctional tools and methodologies.

speakers.name: René Walter
speakers.biography: René Walter betreibt seit Mitte 2005 das Blog Nerdcore, hat damit eine der ersten deutschen Webmemes initiiert und ist ein ausgewiesener Netzkultur-Junkie.

speakers.biography: Sybille Klotz ist strategische Beraterin und Coach. Als Gründungsmitglied von DeltaBerlin Network berät sie im Kontext »Organizational Change, Digitale Communication and Technology«. Zu Ihren Kunden zählen u.a. Verbände, Öffentliche Institutionen und Technologie- und Medienunternehmen sowohl in Deutschland als auch in und den USA. Sie ist Virtual Volunteer und Mitgründerin des Bpeace Team Germany.

speakers.biography: Steffen Liebener arbeitet als systemischer Coach, Trainer und Berater. Bei seinen Projekten stehen umfassende Veränderungen und Entwicklungen auf der Tagesordnung. Als Gründungsmitglied und Partner von DeltaBerlin Network berät er mit dem Schwerpunkt Change und Organisationsberatung im Kontext digitalen Wandels. Seine Überzeugung ist, dass die Welt zukünftig aus Unternehmen und Organisationen mit kollaborierenden Teams und variablen Netzwerkinstanzen bestehen wird.

Mobilfunkunternehmen, Banken, öffentliche Institutionen und ein großer nationaler Sportverband. Seine Schwerpunkte sind Teamentwicklung in international-verteilten Teams (High Performing Teams) und Changeprozesse im digitalen Wandel. Er ist dort im Fachreferat für die Informations- und Medienwirtschaft zuständig für Netzwerke, Innovationen und deren Förderung. Nach seinem Studium war er in der Industrieforschung tätig und arbeitete Anfang der 90er Jahre bei einem Projektträger des Bundesforschungsministeriums.
Zu seinen Schwerpunktthemen bei der Umsetzung der länderübergreifenden Innovationsstrategie im Zukunftsfeld IKT/Medien zählen neben Open Government auch Sicherheit mit IT sowie das „Internet der Dienste“.

He is a member of the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs (LIBE) and a substitute member of the Jan Philipp Albrecht is spokesperson for Justice and Home Affairs of the Greens/EFA in the European Parliament. He is a member of the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs (LIBE), a substitute member of the Committee on Legal Affairs (JURI) and Coordinator of the Green Group in the European Parliament in the Special Committee on Organised Crime, Corruption and Money Laundering (CRIM). Since March 2012, Jan Philipp Albrecht is the rapporteur of the European Parliament for the data protection
regulation. From 2003 until his election in the European Parliament in 2009, he studied Law in Bremen, Berlin and Brussels and was a student of Legal Informatics at the universities of Hannover and Oslo. speakers.organization: r0g_agency for open culture and critical transformation
speakers.biography: Stephen Kovats is a cultural and media researcher with a background in architecture and urbanism, currently setting up r0g - the Berlin agency for open systems, cultural hacktivism and critical transformation. He was artistic director of transmediale, Berlin's festival for art and digital culture 2008 - 2011 and co-director of the McLuhan in Europe 2011 Centennial Network. Previously he curated the international program at V2_Institute for the Unstable Media, Rotterdam, and was director of the 'ostranenie' media art forum at the Bauhaus Dessau during the 1990's. His interests are focussed on the dynamic relationships between media, political, and electronic space and their application on the transformation of societal and cultural landscapes. These aims are pursued through his r0g_projects incl. Circumpolar Cultures and Technology and the #OSJUBA initiative to implement open source and cultural technologies in the establishment of the new state of South Sudan.

speakers.name: Hendrik Kalb
speakers.biography:
Hendrik is a PhD researcher from the TU Berlin working in the BlogForever, a collaborative EU funded project of 12 academic and non-academic partners, e.g. the CERN. BlogForever will create a software platform capable of aggregating, preserving, managing and disseminating blogs. Any user or organization will be able to use the BlogForever software & guidelines to create a digital repository containing their own selection of blogs.
Hendriks primary research interests are individual and collaborative behaviour in Web 2.0 and Social Software, especially in the field of knowledge management and e-learning. His PhD thesis focus on the intention of scientists to share open science resources and open educational resources with social software. He has been involved in research as a scientific assistant since 2004.

speakers.biography: Lagu Stephen is a medical student and film maker from Juba, South Sudan. He is founder of Kapital Movie Industry Corporation (http://www.kapitalmovie.net), a network of visionary young artists and documentarists, web developers, partly in affiliation with the University of Juba, Ministry of Communication, and South Sudan Television. As a group committed to empowering the communities they live, work and study in, Kapital Movie's focus messages are about health, conflict mitigation, capacity building, employment opportunity, the development of peaceful methods of association through the power of films and short commercials. Lagu Stephen is producing the video documentation of the recent 'MEDIA & MAKERS JUBA 2012 Open Knowledge and Sustainable Media Forum', and as such is also a member of the #OSJUBA team exploring the use and application of open systems in the development of South Sudan.

Nach und nach erkennt er, dass hier noch großartige Chancen auf der Strecke liegen bleiben. 2013 beschließt Michael deshalb, dieser Situation entgegenzuwirken: Zusammen mit Peter Monien und Florian Bergmann gründet er destimate. speakers.name: Wael  Fakharany
speakers.biography:
Wael Fakharany occupies the position of the regional director of Google Egypt & North Africa with an experience that extends for more than 23 years in the technology field, as he is considered one of the leading figures that push both technology and digital media industries in the region forward; with both sectors influencing the lives of millions of Arab Internet users.
Wael Fakharany presides over the creation, and execution of the business strategies and operations management in Google throughout Egypt and the Middle East. His occupational duties include aiding in the creation of a suitable Internet ecosystem, as well as collaborating with the biggest organizations and entities in order to further develop the Internet ecosystem in the region; this is in addition to his work on developing advertisement content and spread in the region.
In addition to the above, Wael also has the ability to discuss a myriad of topics and issues in depth in relation to the initiatives of the private sector in start up markets, the development of start-ups, and developing the capabilities of young entrepreneurs in the Arab region via the use of advanced technology and through encouraging innovation.

speakers.biography: Eugenio Tisselli is one of the creators and coordinators of Sauti Ya Wakulima, “The Voices of the Farmers”, a collaborative knowledge base created by farmers in Chambezi, Tanzania. Gathering audiovisual evidence of their practice using smartphones to publish images and voice recordings online the projects aim to document their work, record their observations of climate changes and expand their network of social relationships. Mr Tisselli collaborated with artist Antoni Abad to design and program the mobile communication project megafone.net, holds a degree in Computer Systems Engineering from Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education in Mexico and a master’s degree in Digital Arts from the UPF, is a member of the Hermeneia research group , director and lecturer on the UPF postgraduate course in Programming for the Digital Arts.

speakers.name: Johnpaul Barretto
speakers.biography:
Johnpaul A. Barretto is a co-founder and currently employed as Community Manager of the KINU Innovation Space, established by KINU Group Limited. KINU is a social enterprise, established by six young Tanzanians, with the mission of concentrating, growing and accelerating the Tanzanian technology and social landscape through capacity building and fostering a culture of innovation and co-creation. Central to the achievement of these goals the the KINU Innovation Space was established to provide an open collaborative creative space to enable the community to participate in the co-creation process and make a joint effort to generate new solutions to social challenges. The KINU Innovation Space was established with funding from The Indigo Trust and Google Inc.
Johnpaul's position as Community Manager of the KINU Innovation Space tasks him with two main objectives; developing, engaging and maintaining the local developer community and enhancing cross sectoral relations. Johnpaul's work with the developer community includes trainings that he leads and facilitates aimed at capacity building. 
Organizationally Johnpaul is tasked with ensuring that the KINU Innovation Space adheres to best practice regarding dispensation of funds and well as achieving milestones set forth at the beginning of the project. He works with various private and public institutions including the World Bank, Google Inc, Ministry of Science, Communication and Technology, and institutions of higher learning such as the University of Dar es Salaam.
Prior to moving back to Tanzania in January of 2012 Johnpaul lived in Fresno, California where he pursued a Bachelors of Arts in Political Science and a Certificate in Geographic Information Systems at California State University Fresno. He was hired as a researcher for the Center for Economic Research and Education of Central California (CERECC) based at California State University Fresno. The research focused on to analyzing the labor market in the central San Joaquin Valley through the creation of an index of economic indicators, based on county wide data sets provided by government sources.
During his time at university, he was actively involved in student organizing as a founding member of the California State University Fresno Amnesty International chapter and as a a volunteer with an environmental conservation group, RiverTree Volunteers, actively securing grant funding for both organizations.
After the completion of his degree Johnpaul was employed as a canvasser by Californians for Voter Turnout, Education and Registration (CALVOTER) to work on campaigns for California Senate District 16 Senator Michael J. Rubio and United States Congressman Jim Costa. Towards the critical stage of the campaign Johnpaul was promoted to lead canvasser with Rubio For Senate, where he managed the canvassing teams in the district.

speakers.name: Erwin Aljukic
speakers.biography:
„Erwin leidet an der Glasknochenkrankheit und ist an den Rollstuhl gefesselt. Oft
tanzt er zusammen mit seinem Rollstuhl auf der Tanzfläche“ - in den 15 Jahren seiner Medienpräsenz hat er solche oder ähnliche Beschreibungen in den Medien schon
öfter über sich gehört oder gelesen. Erwin Aljukic ist einer der einzigen professionell arbeitenden Schauspieler (TV, Kino und Theater) mit einer körperlichen Behinderung in Deutschland – den allermeisten ist er bekannt aus der ARD-Serie „Marienhof“. Während er selber als Schauspieler das Objekt der Berichterstattung und das „zu verkaufende“ Produkt ist, kennt Erwin auch die andere Seite, hat er parallel zur Schauspielerei
Modejournalismus studiert. Hier wiederum hat er die Mechanismen der Presse und des
Marktes kennengelernt und was es heißt, ein Produkt zielgruppenspezifisch kommunizieren
zu müssen. Aus diesen beiden Polen ist es stets Erwins größte Intention, den Menschen Mut zu machen, auch indem sich Filmschaffende mehr trauen, eine differenziertere Normalität mit dem Thema Behinderung darzustellen.

speakers.name: Dirk Elsner
speakers.biography: Dirk Elsner ist gelernter Banker und hat Betriebswirtschaftslehre studiert. Für die INNOVECS GmbH berät er heute  Banken und mittelständische Unternehmen. Beruflich wie privat befasst er sich mit Veränderungen in der Wirtschaft und im Finanzwesen, insbesondere auch mit den Entwicklungen im Next-Banking-Umfeld. Elsner betreibt das Weblog Blick Log, das 2012 mit dem comdirect finanzblog award ausgezeichnet wurde. Darüber hinaus verfasst er eine regelmäßige Kolumne zum Wandel in der Finanzwelt für das „Wall Street Journal“.

speakers.biography: Sarah Pust ist seit 1998 im Medienbereich tätig. In Stationen bei Print und Online (Zeitschriften, Zeitungen und ihre Online-Magazine), Radio, Fernsehen, Presseagenturen und E-Learning arbeitete sie in Hamburg, Berlin, Nürnberg, Bamberg und Amsterdam. Nach Festanstellungen bei der Bertelsmann AG/ scoyo.de und dem Egmont Ehapa Verlag arbeitet sie frei und selbstständig als Journalistin, Texterin und Beraterin. speakers.name: Wole Odetayo
speakers.biography: The doctor turned enterprise developer admits that the connection between Medicine & Business Management fields is "Systematic Review". Born and raised in different cities in the southern hemisphere of Nigeria, Wole grew up contributing in different capacities to the then thriving family business. As a student, he won his university's approval to run her bookshop. Wole also launched a thriving multi-location telecom services business on campus which he later exited to focus on his stock market investments for want of studytime. All these on-going business experiences backed with an unending interest in business development informed his decision to settle for building 3rd party enterprises for a living through tech-venture incubation. Wole, a co-founder of Wennovation Hub, is a national gold medalist in chess and scrabble. He is also a devout Christian.

speakers.biography: Mario Sixtus, geboren 1965 in Ratingen, lebt und arbeitet als freier Journalist, Autor und TV-Produzent in Berlin. Für ZDFinfo steht er wöchentlich als “Elektrischer Reporter” vor der Kamera, dem Magazin für Netzkultur und -politik. Sixtus beschäftigt sich seit 15 Jahren mit den Wechselwirkungen zwischen Netz und Gesellschaft. Texte von ihm erschienen u.a. in der ZEIT, in der Frankfurter Allgemeinen Sonntagszeitung, im Focus, im Wirtschaftsmagazin brand eins, sowie in den Fachzeitschriften Technology Review und c’t. 2007 wurde Sixtus mit dem Grimme Online Awarde in der Kategorie “Wissen und Bildung” ausgezeichnet. Seit 2008 ist er geschäftsführender Gesellschafter der Fernseh- und Web-Video-Produktionsfirma “Blinkenlichten Produktionen”.

speakers.name: Moritz Simon Geist
speakers.biography: Moritz Simon Geist, born in 1981. His projects range from tonal hacking to robotics and automated robotic instrument, adding a new perspective to the “man-machine-interface”. But his installations go beyond the basic physical and technical demand: the main theme is rather the transition from a deterministic (usually binary) system into the physical and mechanical world. This transformation entains an greater stress on the “error” of the physical world and lets the object be both more tangible and vulnerable. Moritz Simon Geist lives and works in Dresden, Germany.

speakers.biography: Sabria David ist Mitgründerin und Leiterin des Slow Media Instituts, das zu den Auswirkungen und Potentialen des digitalen Wandels auf Gesellschaft, Arbeit und Medien forscht und berät. Für den Bereich des betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagement entwickelt sie ein Modell zum digitalen Arbeitsschutz aus medienwissenschaftlicher Perspektive. Mit dem Soziologen Benedikt Köhler und dem Marktforscher Jörg Blumtritt verfasste sie 2010 das Slow Media Manifest, das in zahlreiche Sprachen übersetzt wurde, sowie 2012 die Declaration of Liquid Culture. Sie studierte Germanistik und Linguistik, forschte zu Textgenese und gründete im Jahr 2000 die Kommunikations-Agentur TEXT-RAUM, die für Unternehmen Markennamen, neue Erzählformen und Digitalstrategien entwickelt.

speakers.name: Richard Allan
speakers.biography:
Richard Allan joined Facebook in June 2009 to lead the company’s public policy work in Europe.
Richard works on a broad portfolio of issues including privacy, online child safety, freedom of expression, e-commerce regulation and public sector uses of social media. He appears regularly in the media as a spokesman for Facebook. 
Prior to joining Facebook, Richard was European Government Affairs Director for Cisco from September 2005 and has been an academic visitor at the Oxford Internet Institute.
From 2008 to 2009 Richard was Chair of the UK Cabinet Office’s Power of Information Task Force working on improving the use of government data. 
Richard was Member of Parliament for Sheffield Hallam from 1997 to 2005 where he specialized in technology policy issues. In July 2010, Richard was appointed to the House of Lords in the UK Parliament.
In the early part of his career Richard was an archaelogist, an NHS IT professional and a locally elected Councillor.

speakers.biography: Kerstin Borras erforscht am Deutschen Elektronen-Synchrotron (DESY), was unsere Welt im Innersten zusammenhält. Als Elementarteilchen-Physikerin leitet sie das mehr als 60-köpfige DESY-Team aus Physikern, Studenten und technischem Personal, das sich mit dem CMS Experiment am Large Hadron Collider (LHC) auf der Suche nach Higgs-Bosonen, super-symmetrischen Teilchen und weiteren Antworten auf spannende Fragen in der Teilchenphysik  befindet. Kerstin ist auch von der sozialen Komponente in Groß-Experimenten fasziniert und übernimmt als Vorsitzende des Konferenz-Komitees Verantwortung für die faire Verteilung  der rund 1300 Konferenzvorträge pro Jahr an die in etwa 3275 Physiker der CMS Kollaboration.

speakers.name: Alt Altman
speakers.biography: Digits is Alt Altman, a minimalist electronic pop artist based in Toronto and Berlin. In April 2012, Digits released Death and Desire featuring a remix by Nite Jewel (Secretly Canadian), and quickly went from an unknown to a critical darling in the UK, culminating in a review in The Guardian which called the mixtape "a near classic of mournful electronica, a synth-pop album to stand alongside the Human League's Dare." The buzz has continued with the release of the "Love is Only Affection" video (premiered by The Fader) and the epic "Street Violence" video premiered by Noisey. Blackbook called him one of five musicians that will define 2013 in their New Regime issue. Digits distributes his albums free of charge to anyone that bought something recently from another musician, a distribution method Wired called "bold and brave." Alt also writes for Canadian electronic music blog Silent Shout, which maintains a social media directory and encourages musicians to promote each other's work.

speakers.name: Christian Mihr
speakers.biography: Christian Mihr is a journalist, international media policy expert and human rights professional. He has been the Executive Director of Reporters without Borders Germany (RWB) since 2012. He's especially dealing with questions of cyber-censorship and online-safety. He has been publishing & lecturing at several universities on international media regulation policies, access to information and journalism, media-systems in Eastern Europe and Latin America and the challenges of creating a European Public Sphere. Prior to joining RWB he worked for several years for n-ost Network for Reporting on Eastern Europe. At n-ost he was the senior editor of euro|topics and Head of Media Policy Projects. Furthermore he worked for several years as an editor and freelancer for various print- and online-media in Germany and Ecuador, as a journalism trainer for a German foundation in Russia and as the head of press and public relations department at one think tank for international development policy. He studied journalism with a specialization in Latin American Studies at the Catholic University of Eichstaett-Ingolstadt and the University of Santiago de Chile.

speakers.name: Klaus Landefeld
speakers.biography:
Klaus Landefeld
ist seit 1997 als Vorstand von eco e.V. für den Bereich Infrastruktur und Netze sowie den Internetknoten DE-CIX verantwortlich.
Er ist Jahrgang 1968, seit 1980 in Datennetzen unterwegs, begleitet das Internet seit 1988 und offeriert Internetdienste seit 1990. Mit „AS3257“ (Nacamar, heute Inteliquent) konzipierte und betrieb er das erste europäische „Tier 1“ Netzwerk.
Für World Online realisierte er bereits 1999 Streaming-Platformen für den Massenbetrieb, welche Konzerte von U2, Eurythmics u.ä. übertrug. In 2000 wurden mit der Dauerübertragung von „Big Brother“ unter Verwendung von „Edge Streaming“ neue technische Maßstäbe gesetzt.
Derzeit beschäftigt er sich mit Planung, Aufbau und Betrieb von Breitbandnetzen (FTTx, DSL), der Einführung von IPv6 und IPTV in Providernetzen sowie der Migration von Sprachdiensten zu IP.
Er ist Mitglied im Lenkungskreis ATRT der Bundesnetzagentur, Mitglied im Beirat Hessen-IT, Mitglied der Expertengruppe "Breitband" des BMWI, war erstes internationales Mitglied von LINX, JPIX sowie Gründungsmitglied bei DENIC eG, AMS-IX und MINX.

speakers.biography: Shahidul Alam was born in Dhaka, Bangladesh, in 1955 and earned a Ph.D. A London University. A well-known photographer, Shahidul has won a number of prizes for his work, including the London Arts Council’s Harvey Harris Trophy and his work has been displayed in leading  galleries around the world. He founded the “Drik Picture Library” at the Bangladesh Photographic Institute “Pathshala” and the Southeast Asian Photographic Institute. As a founding member of the Bangladesh Human Rights Network, he is currently building a center for investigative journalism and has worked as a prominent activist in the creation of Bangladesh’s first Web portal. Shahidul holds presentations around the world on topic including photography, new media and education. Shahidul is a founding member and advisor in the LEARN Foundation, which is dedicated to ICT training in rural regions.

speakers.name: Moez Chakchouk
speakers.biography:
Graduated from the Sup’Com Engineering School, Tunisia in 1998, Moez Chakchouk received his M.S in telecommunications from the ENIT Engineering School in 2001. In February 2009, he achieved his Ph.D in telecommunications and applied mathematics, under the joint tuition of El Manar University, Tunisia and Paris Descartes University, France.
He started his career in 1998 as a research engineer in The Center of Telecommunication Studies and Research (CERT). Then, he joined in July 2005 the Telecommunications Regulation Authority (INT), first as chief of the technical department, later he became the Director of Interconnection & Access. In March 2010, he was appointed as Adviser to the Minister of Communications Technology.
A few weeks after the Tunisian revolution, Chakchouk became Chairman and CEO of the Tunisian Internet Agency (ATI). His aim is to redefine ATI’s role, which used to be the former governments instrument to censorship the internet. With the help of his team, he launched the first IXP in the maghreb Arab region: TunIXP. Furthermore, he wants to investigate the potential of the internet for social and political change in Tunisia.

speakers.biography:
Silke Horn, IT-Projektmanagerin und Inhaberin von Schmetterlong, einem jungen Dienstleistungsunternehmen für barrierefreie Kommunikation und integrativer Informationstechnologie. Sie legt besonderen Wert darauf, dass die von Ihrem Unternehmen erarbeiteten Lösungen dem Nutzer optimal dienen. Dies gilt besonders bei der Erstellung bedienfreundlicher Software, die es jedem Anwender ermöglicht, ein Höchstmaß an Unabhängigkeit und Lebensqualität zu erlangen. 
Ein Schwerpunkt ihrer Tätigkeit ist das Management von IT-Projekten, die die Barrierefreiheit unterstützen. Die Firma Schmetterlong hat eine iPhone App "UKsimpel" für unterstützte Kommunikation entwickelt.

speakers.name: Horst Zuse
speakers.biography:
Dr.-Ing. Horst Zuse wurde 1945 geboren und studierte von 1967 bis 1973 Elektrotechnik an der Technischen Universität Berlin (TUB).
Im Jahr 1985 promovierte er auf dem Gebiet der Softwarekomplexitätsmaße und es folgte 1987 ein einjähriger Forschungsaufenthalt am IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center in Yorktown Heights / New York in den USA.
1991 publizierte er das Buch: Horst Zuse: Software Complexity - Measures and Methods, im DeGruyter Verlag und 1998 erschien das Buch: Horst Zuse: A Framework of Software Measurement, DeGruyter Verlag.
Im Jahr 1998 verlieh der Fachbereichsrat Informatik der TU-Berlin ihm im Rahmen des Habilitationsverfahrens die Lehrbefähigung und –befugnis (Privatdozent) auf dem Gebiet der Praktischen Informatik.
Von Dezember 2003-2006 war er Gastprofessor an der Fachhochschule Lausitz (FHL) und seit November ist er dort Honorarprofessor.  Am 20.12.2009 wurde er zum Professor ernannt.

speakers.name: lidi brouwer
speakers.biography:
"Interactive Landscapes".
Presentation topic:
The lecture shows a world shifting between the analog and the digital.
Studio Roosegaarde creates interactive designs that explore the
dynamic relation between space, people, and technology. The studio
develops its own technology and is internationally known for
interactive projects such as Dune, Intimacy and Smart Highway.
Speakers profile:
Studio Roosegaarde is the social design lab of artist Daan Roosegaarde
with his team of designers and engineers. By creating interactive
designs that instinctively respond to sound and movement, Studio Roosegaarde
explores the dawn of a new nature that is evolving from technological
innovations.
Studio Roosegaarde has been the focus of exhibitions at the Tate Modern, the
National Museum in Tokyo, the Victoria and Albert Museum in London and
winner of two Dutch Design Awards, the Media Architecture Award and
China's Most Successful Design Award. Studio Roosegaarde also has a
strong experience with public space commissions for the City of
Rotterdam, Singapore, Eindhoven and Stockholm.
Recently Studio Roosegaarde launched its second studio in Shanghai,
CN. I am the China Representative of Studio Roosegaarde and studied
economics and trade with a focus on Asia, in specific China.
I do speak chinese and had my own production and trading company,
while living in China I started to help Studio Roosegaarde with their China affairs.
And am now full-time part of the team, doing their strategy, business development and communications.

sessions.title: Interactive Landscapes

speakers.name: Markus Löning
speakers.position: Beauftragter der Bundesregierung für Menschenrechtspolitik und Humanitäre Hilfe
speakers.biography: Markus Löning, geb. am 02.07.1960 in Meppen/Ems, wuchs in Deutschland, den Niederlanden und Luxemburg auf. Er studierte an der University of Kent at Canterbury und Politikwissenschaften an der Universität Heidelberg. Als Geschäftsführer einer Grafikfirma und als freier Mitarbeiter einer Werbeagentur gründete er 1996 seine eigene Werbeagentur. 1989 trat er in die FDP ein. Seit 2001 gehört er dem Bundesvorstand der FDP an und zog 2002 erstmals auf der Landesliste Berlin in den Bundestag ein. Seit 2005 fungiert er als Vizepräsident der Europäischen Liberalen Partei (ELDR). 2009 schied er aus dem Bundestag aus. Im April 2010 wurde er zum Beauftragten der Bundesregierung für Menschenrechtspolitik und Humanitäre Hilfe ernannt.

speakers.name: Paul Nemitz
speakers.position: Director, Fundamental rights and Union citizenship
speakers.biography:
Paul F. Nemitz is the Director responsible for Fundamental rights and Union citizenship in the Directorate-General Justice of the European Commission. 
Before joining DG Justice, he held posts in the Legal Service of the Commission, the Cabinet of Commissioner Nielson, and in the Directorates General for Trade, Transport and Maritime Affairs. He has a broad experience as agent of the Commission in litigation before the European Courts and he has published extensively on EU law. 
Nemitz was admitted to the Bar in Hamburg and for a short time was a teaching assistant at Hamburg University. He obtained a Master of Comparative Law from George Washington University Law School in Washington, D.C., where he was a Fulbright grantee. He also passed the first and second cycle of the Strasburg Faculty for comparative law, with the support of a grant by the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD).

speakers.name: Tina Gadow
speakers.biography: Tina Gadow studierte Theaterwissenschaft und kulturelle Kommunikation in Paris und Berlin. Nach dem Studium arbeitete sie zunächst im Hauptstadtbüro des Goethe-Instituts und war anschließend vier Jahre lang für den Schwerpunkt ›Kultur und Entwicklung‹ im Büro Berlin der GTZ zuständig. Kern ihrer Arbeit war immer die Auseinandersetzung mit gesellschaftlichen und (kultur-) politischen Themen im Rahmen von Wortveranstaltungen. Der Wunsch danach, mehr Kreativität und Vergnügen in diese Begegnungen zu bringen, dabei unterschiedliche Ansätze, Entwürfe und Perspektiven zusammen zu führen und mit Akteuren aus Zivilgesellschaft, Politik und Kultur gleichermaßen eng zusammen zu arbeiten führte sie in die Selbständigkeit: unter dem Motto Vielfalt gestalten gründete sie 2008 ihr eigenes Büro in Berlin. Seitdem konzipiert, berät, begleitet und moderiert sie internationale und lokale Konferenzen, Workshops, Salons, Netzwerktreffen. 2010 gründete sie das Netzwerk der „kongress tanzt“ und koordiniert dessen Aktivitäten. www.tinagadow.de; www.der-kongress-tanzt.net

speakers.name: Yoani Sánchez
speakers.biography: Six years ago, Yoani Sánchez started "Generación Y," the first independent blog in Cuba. Her critical look at daily life and politics on the socialist island earned the blogger international attention and she became a prominent voice of Cuban society that official media refused to cover. The 37-year-old has been honored with a number of awards, including Deutsche Welle's Bobs award. Cuban authorities refused Yoani Sánchez the right to leave the country 20 times before she was permitted to travel abroad in 2013. Her trip through Latin America, Europe and North America brings her to Berlin in May for re:publica.

As a grant-maker for the Ford Foundation, I supported many independent media and arts organizations in East Africa. I write occasional op-eds for the Daily Nation, and have reviewed books for the Times Literary Supplement and an assessed entries for the Noma Award for African Writing. I have also published academic articles in a number of refereed journals (e.g. African Affairs). speakers.name: James Clardy
speakers.biography:
James Clardy is an Austin, Texas based technology strategist and global business development executive, with a history of industry transforming telecom, consumer electronics, networking, multimedia, gaming and computing products. He's currently interested in the "Internet of Things", incl. cyber-physical systems, sensor networks, embedded & wearable computing, natural user interaction, augmented reality, related privacy and security concerns, big data analytics and cloud-enabled contextually relevant services. James has extensive experience building alliances and ecosystems around emerging technology, fostering the transfer of knowledge and stimulating the creative economy via collaboration. Over the years, James has taken a leading role in numerous standards bodies and normative organizations, adding informed input and considered opinion, engaging in civil debate, advocating consensus. As a lean principle evangelist, he provides consulting services to early-stage entrepreneurial ventures. Raised on the boarder in Texas, speaking Spanish, now living in a German speaking household, James is multilingual with cross-cultural skills earned throughout the U.S., Europe, Middle East and Asia Pacific. In his spare time, James is building an underwater ROV, scuba dives and goes wilderness trekking in deserts across the Southwest U.S.

speakers.name: Florian Sievers
speakers.biography:
Florian is a trained Journalist for Economics and former editor of Groove magazine for electronic music and club culture. He works as a freelance writer in Berlin, writing about music and economics alike, as long as there are interesting people involved.
In the recent past he has met exceptionally many of these people in African countries. Which just adds to his fascination for that continent coming from the feeling that all the music which touches him is bascially rooted in Africa, from Blues to Techno.
Currently Florian is co-editing a reader about club culture, urban space and public sphere in ten African and European cities together with Goethe-Institut Nairobi/Kenya. It is part of the project Ten Cities which also includes an exchange programme of electronic music producers between the involved cities.

speakers.name: Esteve Almirall
speakers.biography:
Esteve serves as Associate Professor in Esade Business School where his research focuses on Innovation, particularly on Open Innovation. His academic work has been referenced in HBR and he is a frequently involved in conferences around Innovation, Smart Cities, Living Labs and Open Data/Gov.
I am passionate about how we can use IT to redefine governance and reinvent citizenship in the XXI century transforming cities from service providers to ecosystem orchestrators and therefore fostering growth and promoting entrepreneurship. I aim to collaborate to this transformation by promoting change amongst cities and engaging them in the bottom-up, grass-roots side of Open Innovation. Right now we are busy recruiting developers/fellows for Code for Europe that we hope will contribute to reshape city governance.
 My background is a mix of Management Science (PhD,MRes,MBA) and Computer Science (MSc, MRes). I am highly involved in European Projects and EU organizations such as the ENoLL (European Network of Living Labs) where I am  Council Member and coordinating the EU projects Open Cities, Commons for Europe (Code for Europe) and Collage.

Her latest sucess was 4 lions at Cannes 2012 for the Red Tomato Pizza VIP Fridge Magnet, including a Gold in mobile. She is the founder of the Adwomen Middle East, an advertising community for women. speakers.biography: One-Woman-Show auf YouTube. Gedankenmülldeponie Online. Amy, 24 Jahre, Mutter, Berlinerin durch und durch - also ich, blogt über alles was sie bewegt und was um sie herum geschieht. Was ihr gefällt oder missfällt wird in eigen(artig)er weise verarbeitet. Ein öffentliches Tagebuch für die Nachwelt. Wie sich DiamondOfTears wandelt und weiterentwickelt kann ab 2004 nachgelesen und gesehen werden. Sie hat ein offenes Ohr für Probleme und unterstützt die "neue Generation" wo sie nur kann. Als Sprachrohr des "anders denkenden, sensibelen" Jung- und Altvolk spricht sie aus, was sie denkt und verschönert keine Geschehen. Wenn es nach ihr geht, wird sie vom Sterbebett aus berichten berichten.

speakers.biography: Sophia New studied Philosophy & Literature with German at Sussex University (1993- 1997) and has an MA in Feminist Performance from Bristol University (1998). She is a co-founder of plan b with Daniel Belasco Rogers. Since 2002 they have made over 25 projects for different cities, festivals, and galleries. Their work is often site specific and includes performance, GPS, sound and video. She also has worked as a solo performer and video maker and has had grants from Artsadmin, the Anglo German foundation in London and Isis Arts in Newcastle. She also works as an independent performer and has worked with Antonia Baehr, Penelope Wehrli, Petra Sabish, Gob Squad, and Forced Entertainment. She has taught on performance courses in Gloucester University, Aberystwyth University and Das Arts in Amsterdam, as well as giving a course on Urban Interventions with Daniel Belasco Rogers at the Hafen City University, Hamburg. She regularly teaches Live Art and Performance with Siegmar Zacharias at Folkwang in Essen and Bochum.

She spent half her twenties in Africa and has been suffering from a mild form of mal d'Afrique ever since. She is curious about connections between the personal, social, political economic and cultural spheres, which gained her a degree in Anthropology. speakers.name: Martin Randelhoff
speakers.biography:
Martin Randelhoff, Jahrgang 1988, studiert seit 2009 Verkehrswirtschaft an der Technischen Universität Dresden. Seit rund drei Jahren betreibt er den Blog „Zukunft Mobilität“ (www.zukunftmobilitaet.net), in dem er sich mit aktuellen Geschehnissen und Entwicklungen im deutschen und internationalen Verkehrsbereich auseinander setzt. Nebenbei berät er Unternehmen, Organisationen und Kommunen in den Bereichen Elektromobilität, nachhaltiger Verkehr, intermodales Verkehrsmittelwahlverhalten, Entwicklungen im ÖPNV und Trendentwicklungen der Mobilität. Er ist zudem als freier Mitarbeiter in diversen Verkehrszeitschriften sowie als Referent im Bildungsbereich tätig. Martin Randelhoff ist Mitglied im Netzwerk Intelligente Mobilität (NiMo) – www.nimo.eu. Das Magazin UNICUM bezeichnete ihn 2012 als einen von zehn „Zukunftsmachern“.
Im Jahr 2012 wurde er für seinem Blog „Zukunft Mobilität“ mit dem Grimme Online Award und dem PUNKT Preis für Technikjournalismus der Deutschen Akademie der Technikwissenschaften ausgezeichnet.

Neben seiner Tätigkeit bei nugg.ad ist er seit 2009 Chairman des Policy Committee beim IAB Europe, dem europäischen Internet-Dachverband. Stephan Noller setzt sich für einheitliche Online-Datenschutzstandards ein, sowie für ethische Normen beim Einsatz von digitalen Relevanz- und Filter-Algorithmen, z.B. über die Initiierung der Data Days (www.data-days.com). Seit 2012 ist er Kolumnist beim ExchangeWire-Blog, dem führenden Blog für datengetriebene Onlinewerbung.

Luci van Org, Berlinerin Jahrgang 1971, trat schon im Alter von 12 Jahren in Blues-Clubs auf, unterschrieb mit 16 ihren ersten Plattenvertrag und war neben der Musik zuerst Kunst- und Anglistikstudentin, Supermarktverkäuferin und Aktmodell, bevor sie 1994 mit ihrer damaligen Band Lucilectric und deren Hit "Mädchen" mal kurz zum gefeierten Popstar wurde. Danach moderierte Luci neben der Musik neun Jahre lang beim rbb- Jugendsender "Fritz", begann TV- und Kinodrehbücher, Theaterstücke und Songs für unzählige Musikerkollegen zu schreiben und tut es bis heute.

speakers.biography:
The Angolan born musician Batida grew up in the suburbs of Lisbon, where he developed a passion for listening to and buying records. But instead of becoming a musician he first pursued a Radio DJ career, where he founded a collective called Fazuma dedicated to promoting Afro-influenced music. The name Batida started as a radio programme and evolved to an album on Soundway Records. The programme is still on air on portugese national radio and in portugese speaking African countries. Batida also has a slot on Ginga Beat from Red Bull Music Academy Radio on the same subject. He is the TEN CITIES curator for Lisbon, Portugal as well as a participant of the TEN CITIES musical collaboration phase in Nairobi, Kenya.
––––––––––––––––––––––––––

speakers.name: Loren Treisman
speakers.biography:
Loren is the Executive of Indigo Trust, a grant making foundation based in London which funds and supports technology-driven projects that bring about social change in Africa. She supports a wide range of programmes which focus mainly on innovation, transparency and citizen empowerment.  Her portfolio also includes innovative projects which utilise Information Technologies to support development outcomes in any sector including the health, education, human rights and agriculture spheres.  The Trust also supports technology innovation hubs across the continent.
           Since completing a PhD in breast cancer research at Cambridge University, Loren has managed, developed strategies and consulted on a variety of development projects in East Africa (predominantly Uganda and Tanzania).  Loren also regularly speaks and facilitates sessions at International Conferences and commentates in the international press including the BBC, CNN, Al Jazeera and The Guardian.
      You may also be interested in reading some of her latest articles:

speakers.name: Joerg Blumtritt
speakers.biography:
Joerg Blumtritt (*1970) is founder and CEO of Datarella™, a Data Science Development Lab based in Munich, Germany.
After having graduated in statistics and political sciences, he started working as a researcher in behavioural sciences. He ran marketing and research teams for TV-channels ProSieben, Sat.1, RTL II and magazine publisher Hubert Burda Media. As European Operations Officer at Tremor Media, Joerg was in charge of building this New York based video ad-network’s European enterprises. Recently he has been working as managing director of MediaCom Germany. For more than ten years, Joerg has also been part of consultancy projects with major media and consumer brands.
He is is co-author of the Slow Media Manifesto and the Declaration of Liquid Culture. Joerg blogs at beautifuldata.net and can be followed at @jbenno.

speakers.name: Ellen Vorac
speakers.biography:
Ellen Voráč, ist seit seit 1994 im Kultur- & Medien Betrieb aktiv. Nach Jahren im Bereich der Ausstellungs-, Seminar- und Event- Organisation neben Ihrem Studium und einer folgenden Qualifikation zur Kulturmanagerin, arbeitete seit 1999 im unabhängigen Musikvertrieb zunächst in Frankfurt und ab 2001 in Hamburg im Produkt Management und als A&R. In diesem Zuge erwarb sie fundierte Kenntnisse über Manufacturing, internationales Musik Marketing und Sales-Promotion, sowie klassisches Label-Management.
Ab 2004 konzentriert Sie sich, mit der Gründung Ihrer eigenen kleinen Agentur electroslam.com, überwiegend auf die die digitale Musikvermarktung und berät als  freier Consultant Vertriebe, Labels und Künstler. So konnte Sie  u.a. maßgeblich am Aufbau des Distributions-Labelpools des unabhängigen digital Dienstleisters finetunes GmbH mitwirken, wo sie bis 2011 das Label- und Sales-Management führte.
Seit Juli 2012 leitet sie beim einem der grössten unabhängigen digital Vertriebe, der Zebralution GmbH in Berlin, hauptamtlich die E-Book und Audio-Book Abteilung.

Mariska [1982] studied graphic design [Arnhem, 2000-2005] and ArtScience Mmus [2010-2012].
In 2009/2010 Mariska received a Startstipendium from Fonds BKVB. In 2011 she was nominated for the STRP Talent Pit and selected for the NewArrivals of Rewire Festival. In 2012 she won the BNG Workspace12 Projectprice and she received twice a project budget from Oddstream.
Mariska presented different works related to the optical sound project at several national and international events like Oddstream Festival [NL], Fiber [NL], Todays Art [NL], Shiny Toys [DE], Linoleum Fest [RUS], Punto y Raya [E], HAFF [NL], Go Short [NL], Rotate [A], STRP [NL], Arti et Amicitiae [NL], Rewire Festival [NL], for the IFFR in Worm [NL] and Atelier Nord [NO].
Since 2012 she’s part of the artist collective iii [Instrument Inventors Initiative].
Mariska de Groot currently resides in Berlin [DE] and Nijmegen [NL]
